sections.heading: Overview
content:
After a career as a university library administrator, Terence Williams
entered Hazelden as a patient in l970. After treatment, in l971, he
participated in Hazelden’s counselor training program, and in l972 helped start
the Hazelden Family Program. Instead of confronting people with their
"dysfunction," the Hazelden Family Program assumes that people are
capable of change when they better understand what’s happening in their
lives.

After 20 years as manager of family services at Hazelden, Williams is now
retired, spending his summers on a boat on the Mississippi River. The rest of
the year he helps his wife, Patricia Hampl, with research for her writing and
does some writing of his own.
